text: - Hi, my name is Richard Borenstein,

and I'm the Chief Strategic
Partnerships Officer
at RingCentral.
How is generative impacting our industry?

Well, the simple answer is
it's impacting all industries,
and if people aren't aware of it,
it's coming pretty quickly.

And what we were fortunate
to do at RingCentral is
to adopt a strategy around AI early on in,

and we've infused it into all
of our platforms and products.
So the impact is massive

in terms of the benefit
that's going to be achieved,

and this is how we're
trying to figure it out
for the end user's benefit is
where AI can become an important piece
of their long-term strategy.
We've gotta make it work for them,
so we're trying to make it a little easier
for end users and for our customers.

What's the biggest misconception
about generative AI?
I think there's two.

One is that all companies now
claim that they are AI ready,
and that's just not true.
They need to say it, but the reality is,
some companies such as RingCentral

have been investing in this
for well over five years
and are already seeing the benefits

as we infuse it into
our product platforms.

The second biggest
misconception, I believe,
is that it's gonna solve everything.
It's not gonna solve everything.
It needs to be applied effectively
and in a smart and capable way
to ensure outcomes are achieved

specifically around net
benefits to the end users.

The security is the bedrock
of what we do at RingCentral.

Reliability and security are
very tightly intertwined.
And we are managing massive call volumes,
messaging, video, and other events.
And one of the things we make sure
that we hold up as primary is
the security of those communications.
And that's embedded as

our thought process
throughout the platform.
As regards AI, we have to

now expand our portfolio
and our capabilities
to ensure that AI lives and is controlled

with the same view of the
utmost in security standards.

How AWS supports RingCentral
on our journey is

to keep being the great
partner that they are

by helping us learn about
new products, capabilities,
and getting us at the front line
of understanding what's coming next

so that we can infuse
that into our roadmap
and work closely together
to make sure that we're getting it right
for the benefit of the customers.

AWS helps our software
company be more progressive.

It helps us think about
the long-term benefits
as well as the short-term goals,
but it gives us platforms and partnership

to be able to do some really
incredible things together
and to really wow our customer base.
We're leading together,
and it's helping us tell a very good story

to the marketplace about
the benefits of AI.
